010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * Represents a hierarchical Gaussian scale space. See Secs. 25.1.2 and 25.1.4
019 * of [1] for more details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/11/20
028 */
029public class GaussianScaleSpace extends HierarchicalScaleSpace<GaussianOctave> {
030
031        /**
032         * Constructor, builds a {@link GaussianScaleSpace} from a {@link FloatProcessor}.
033         * 
034         * @param fp a {@link FloatProcessor}
035         * @param P the number of scale space octaves
036         * @param Q the number of scale steps (levels) per octave
037         * @param sigma_s the assumed sampling scale (typ. 0.5)
038         * @param sigma_0 the base scale of level 0 
039         * @param botLevel the index of the bottom level in each octave
040         * @param topLevel the index of the to level in each octave
041         */
042        public GaussianScaleSpace(FloatProcessor fp, int P, int Q, double sigma_s, double sigma_0, int botLevel, int topLevel) {
043                super(P, Q, sigma_s, sigma_0, botLevel, topLevel);      
044                build(fp);
045        }
046        
047        // -------------------------------------------------------------
048        
049        private final void build(FloatProcessor fp) {
050                double scaleA = getAbsoluteScale(0, botLevel) ;                 // absolute scale of level(0,-1) = bottom
051                double scaleR = Math.sqrt(sqr(scaleA) - sqr(sigma_s));  // relative scale from sampling scale
052                
053                float[] data = ((float[])fp.getPixels()).clone();
054                ScaleLevel Ginit = new ScaleLevel(fp.getWidth(), fp.getHeight(), data, scaleR);
055                Ginit.filterGaussian(scaleR);
056                
057                // create the bottom octave
058                setOctave(0, new GaussianOctave(0, Q, Ginit, botLevel, topLevel, sigma_0));
059                // build the remaining Q-1 octaves:
060                for (int p = 1; p < P; p++) {
061                        // get the top level of the previous octave and decimate it:
062                        ScaleLevel Gbase = getOctave(p-1).getLevel(Q-1).decimate();
063                        setOctave(p, new GaussianOctave(p, Q, Gbase, botLevel, topLevel, sigma_0));
064                }
065        }
066        
067}
